title.justification: The title is clearly mentioned on the first page of the paper.

extractions.description: The paper introduces a novel path perturbation technique for Metropolis Light Transport (MLT) that adaptively updates state-dependent parameters of the proposal distribution, based on the history of the Markov chain. The approach partitions the path space along a few dimensions, resulting in low-dimensional canonical spaces associated with adaptive parameters, refined through an adaptive quadtree structure. The method aims to improve rendering efficiency in photorealistic image generation by reducing correlation in the Markov chain.

type.justification: The paper includes experimental results and comparisons of different path perturbation techniques using various scenes, demonstrating the efficacy of the proposed methods.
type.quote: We demonstrated that our approach can generate a Markov chain with less correlation, and thus results in better exploration performance compared to fixed-sized kernels or global adaptation.

name.justification: The paper is focused on techniques for photorealistic image generation, which falls squarely within the domain of computer graphics.
name.quote: Generating photorealistic synthetic images is one of the original objectives of computer graphics.

name.justification: The core subject of the paper is improving rendering efficiency through adaptive MCMC methods.
name.quote: This paper applies adaptive Markov chain Monte Carlo. Here we focus on the most closely related previous work, and refer the reader to PBRT [PJH16] for an extensive introduction to rendering.

name.justification: The paper heavily relies on and contributes to adaptive MCMC methods as applied to rendering.
name.quote: We base our approach on the theoretical framework of regional adaptive MCMC which enables the adaptation of parameters depending on the region of the state space which contains the current sample, and on information collected from previous samples.

name.justification: The paper utilizes and builds upon the Metropolis Light Transport model for path sampling in rendering.
name.quote: Metropolis light transport (MLT) is the first application of MCMC to rendering [VG97].
